title: Technical Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fauna & Flora International
Interview Descriptions: The interview itself was well structured and followed guidelines. However, communication was not delivered when responding to applicants about their decision. I was left waiting two weeks to hear back with no explanation and then left another two weeks for feedback which was written poorly and inapropriate.
Interview Questions: Skills, Experiences, Behaviour, and all sorts of generic questions that are scenario based.

title: Programme Officer, Conservation Science & Design Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fauna & Flora International in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was around 1 h long with two workers of the department. They were very friendly and the questions they asked all related to the competences needed for the job.
Additionally I was sent a project proposal and had to answer the person who wrote it with comments on the strengths of the application and  suggestions on improvements
Interview Questions:
How would you approach x situation
Tell me about a situation in which you had to work in a team and your role in the group
What do you think are the challenges conservation organisations face currently
What do they have to focus on
Which of the values of our organisation do you identify with the most and why

title: Programmer Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fauna & Flora International
Interview Descriptions:
HR don't even acknowledge receipt of your application, let alone get back to you about the result. This is such a shame as the company appears really excellent and I have applied to multiple roles within FFI, yet the experience is always the same.

I understand when applying to positions at small companies this may be the case, however each application has its own member of HR assigned, it's really not difficult to send a generic 'we received your application'.

This feels particularly demotivating in the current jobs market, shame on you FFI.

title: Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fauna & Flora International in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and lovely approach from the interviewers. Apparent that FFI values were very important. Were open to internal training and add it comfortable and not scary, everyone i met was really lovely
Interview Questions: How my experience would impact the organisation

title: Green Knowledge Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Fauna & Flora International (Jakarta) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Interview session via phone but not sufficent interview time. interview question to general. need more deep elaboration to get better interview. intangible strengths and soft skills not explored enough. good environment and condition from interviewer. the interview did not have a good idea
of the core of my strengths  would bring to the job, and then take the chance
to highlight those skills with my answer. For example, if i want to
emphasize my organizational skills in a particular interview, i might tell
a story of how i organized an elaborate fundraiser at my child’s school,
or how i were the president of a particular club at university.
Interview Questions: what do you reckon/know for the vacant position
